# PTD Today Monthly Intelligence Brief (Last 30 Days)

## 1) Top Themes
- Advances and challenges in offshore and onshore renewable energy projects
- Growing role of AI and digital solutions in energy and data center sectors
- Solar energy market dynamics including pricing, manufacturing, and policy updates
- Infrastructure security concerns impacting subsea data transmission
- Emerging requirements in domestic content for energy storage and manufacturing

## 2) Top Stories
- Orsted has legally challenged the US government’s halt on its $5 billion offshore wind project (Source: Reuters).  
- China leads in offshore wind single-unit turbine capacity with new 15 MW turbines installed by Vestas (Source: offshorewind.biz).  
- Apollo becomes a co-owner of the Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm, reinforcing investment in large-scale wind projects (Source: offshorewind.biz).  
- UK solar is projected to reach record Contract for Difference (CfD) deployment volumes in 2026, signaling strong market growth (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- India mandates a 20% domestic content requirement for battery storage projects, aiming to boost local manufacturing (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- Finnish police have seized a ship allegedly responsible for cutting a subsea cable, detaining a Russian crew—raising concerns over critical data infrastructure security (Source: datacenterdynamics.com).  
- Tata Power Renewable completed a 1 GW Domestic Content Requirement (DCR) compliant photovoltaic (PV) project for SJVN in India (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- US market expected to reach 737.8 GW of installed solar capacity by 2035, reflecting sustained expansion (Source: pv-magazine.com).

## 3) Sector Takeaways

### Grid / Transmission
- Security vulnerability highlighted by the incident of subsea cable cutting and subsequent ship seizure in Finland, underscoring risks to critical data and power transmission infrastructure.

### Renewables
- Offshore wind continues expansion with significant installations and investment, particularly led by China and reinforced by new stakeholders like Apollo in large wind farms.
- UK and India push renewable adoption via record program deployments and domestic content mandates respectively.
- India’s move on domestic content in battery storage projects supports localized manufacturing, potentially impacting supply chains.
- Record solar deployment forecasts in the US and new tenders in Bangladesh indicate strong global market growth.

### Oil & Gas
- Not enough information in the headline to report.

### Data Centers & AI
- AI integration emerging in renewable tech with new digital twin applications for floating PV systems.
- Discussions on AI's role and economics in 2026 suggest continued growth and investment in AI-driven technologies relevant to energy and data sectors.

### Critical Minerals
- India’s domestic content requirements for battery storage imply focus on local sourcing of minerals and components, but no specific mineral details provided.

## 4) Notable Companies / Regions Mentioned
- Companies: Orsted, Vestas, Apollo, Tata Power Renewable, Waaree Energies  
- Regions: China, US, UK, India, Bangladesh, Finland
